issue.message: READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE is deprecated (and is not granted) when targeting Android 13+. If you need to query or interact with MediaStore or media files on the shared storage, you should instead use one or more new storage permissions: `READ_MEDIA_IMAGES`, `READ_MEDIA_VIDEO` or `READ_MEDIA_AUDIO`.
WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE is deprecated (and is not granted) when targeting Android 13+. If you need to write to shared storage, use the `MediaStore.createWriteRequest` intent.

READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE is deprecated (and is not granted) when targeting Android 13+. If you need to query or interact with MediaStore or media files on the shared storage, you should instead use one or more new storage permissions: `READ_MEDIA_IMAGES`, `READ_MEDIA_VIDEO` or `READ_MEDIA_AUDIO`.
WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE is deprecated (and is not granted) when targeting Android 13+. If you need to write to shared storage, use the `MediaStore.createWriteRequest` intent.
A newer version of com.google.firebase:firebase-bom than 32.7.3 is available: 33.3.0
A newer version of androidx.fragment:fragment than 1.5.9 is available: 1.8.3
A newer version of org.jetbrains.kotlin:kotlin-stdlib than 1.9.0 is available: 1.9.20
A newer version of androidx.appcompat:appcompat-resources than 1.5.1 is available: 1.7.0
A `<queries>` declaration should generally be used instead of QUERY_ALL_PACKAGES; \ see https://g.co/dev/packagevisibility for details
This folder configuration (`v21`) is unnecessary; `minSdkVersion` is 23. Merge all the resources in this folder into `drawable`.

The image `ic_launcher.png` varies significantly in its density-independent (dip) size across the various density versions: mipmap-hdpi/ic_launcher.png: 48x48 dp (72x72 px), mipmap-mdpi/ic_launcher.png: 72x72 dp (72x72 px), mipmap-xhdpi/ic_launcher.png: 36x36 dp (72x72 px), mipmap-xxhdpi/ic_launcher.png: 24x24 dp (72x72 px), mipmap-xxxhdpi/ic_launcher.png: 18x18 dp (72x72 px)
The `ic_launcher.png` icon has identical contents in the following configuration folders: mipmap-hdpi, mipmap-mdpi, mipmap-xhdpi, mipmap-xxhdpi, mipmap-xxxhdpi
